page.title: 01Eskdale, north of Langholm
page.content: The western half of this area is hills used for sheep grazing. There are no farm houses in that area. There is one shepherd's cottage at the burn, Carlesgill, Westkirk. The B709 Langholm Eskdalemuir road and the river Esk run through the eastern section at Potholm and Milnholm farms. Stock is mainly sheep, Cheviots on the hills , Cheviot Suffolk crossed in the fields. Cattle are also reared with barley and swede turnips grown for winter feed. Grass is grown for silage. A private company rears pheasants on Buccleuch estates, Castleholm for private shoots in season. Langholm agricultural show, in September annually, on lower Castleholm has competitions in sheaf tossing, tug of war, terrier racing, to compliment stock classes, flowers and vegetables.
